newsitem.title: JAPAN: Ex-Japan coalition party heads to meet at 0800 GMT.
newsitem.headline: Ex-Japan coalition party heads to meet at 0800 GMT.

text.p: The heads of the three parties in Japan's outgoing coalition government will hold a meeting on Monday afternoon to discuss cooperation after general elections on Sunday, an official of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) said.

Secretaries-general of the three parties have agreed that their leaders, including Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto, who is president of the LDP, will meet at 5 p.m. (0800 GMT), the official told Reuters.
The two other coalition partners are the Social Democratic Party and Sakigake.
Hashimoto's LDP emerged as the biggest winner in Sunday's polls, but its tally of 239 seats was 12 short of the 251 it needed to govern alone in the 500-seat Lower House.

In the outgoing coalition government, the LDP was the dominant partner in an alliance with the Social Democrats and Sakigake, a small LDP splinter group. The LDP said after the poll it would seek to form a new coalition.
"I don't advocate it as low as 125.14. But we should see a 125.58 trade and on a break, sure enough, there's a risk down to 125.36," he said.
Part of the problem for the notionnel is the stubborness of resistance at 126.60, analysts said. That area has stopped the market several times in the past few weeks.
"A break above 126.60 would trigger a retest of the 126.80 high," said analysts at Chase in a note to clients.
"A further break above here would resume the major uptrend, targeting major resistance at the 127.20 level initially, which represents a gap from 1993," they said.
